Description: Rim sherd (mended from two fragments) of North Ionian black-figured pottery bowl; interior streakily glazed with traces of added colour bands; exterior:tongues between bands at rim; below, large, seemingly legless, bird to left, the body resembling an inverted lotus flower, with incision and added red; rosette as fill; below band with added rerd band lined in white and broken maeander frieze.
Curator's comments: The piece is very close to 1924,1201.951, and is probably from the same vase. It is less likely that the texts on the two belong to the same phrase, since the length of the tongues with their lower boundary line is slightly different at the relevant breaks. The uncertainty of the inscriber is apparent on both sherds, and the wheel-marks coincide.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GG.200)
